Dr. Sharlene Smith Takes Leadership Role in Pediatric Nursing
Addison PerryUpdated: 04-23-2025 06:24 PM
Dr. Sharlene Smith Takes Leadership Role in Pediatric Nursing
Florida Southern College proudly announces that Dr. Sharlene Smith, Ph.D., DNP, APRN, CPNP-AC/PC, has been appointed as the Anne MacGregor Jenkins Endowed Chair in Pediatric Nursing. This distinguished position highlights the commitment of the College to enhance pediatric health education.
Professional Journey of Dr. Sharlene Smith
Dr. Smith began her academic journey in 2012 and quickly established herself in the field of nursing education. Initially, she joined Florida Southern College as an adjunct faculty member in the graduate nursing program and transitioned to a full-time role in 2024. Her focus at the School of Nursing and Health Sciences as Associate Professor and Educational Coordinator is to enrich child health initiatives and educational outcomes.
A Passion for Improving Child Health
Dr. Smith expressed her pride in receiving this chair, stating, "This endowment enables us to elevate our focus on child health and educational initiatives, thereby impacting the community and beyond." Her impressive educational background includes both a Ph.D. in nursing and a Doctor of Nursing Practice, reflecting her deep commitment to enhancing healthy lifestyle practices and reducing stress in families with young children.
Innovative Teaching and Community Engagement
Throughout her career, Dr. Smith has balanced clinical practice with her teaching roles. With extensive experience in both primary and urgent care, she has made significant contributions through her role as a program director for a pediatric nurse practitioner program. She has engaged students in various aspects of nursing education, emphasizing pathophysiology, pharmacology, and community health.
Impact on Community Health Initiatives
Dr. Smith's dedication extends beyond academia. She received a $33,000 grant aimed at enhancing the health of urban children by collaborating with local agencies. Her efforts include participation in several committees that focus on improving healthcare curricula and practices across educational institutions.
Global Health Contributions
Her commitment to health continues on a global scale. Dr. Smith has participated in numerous medical missions to provide care to underserved communities, sharing invaluable experiences with her students. Her involvement with DOCARE International exemplifies her dedication to ensuring people worldwide have access to necessary healthcare resources.
About Florida Southern College
Established in 1883, Florida Southern College stands as the oldest private college in the state, committed to doctrinal excellence and comprehensive education across more than 70 undergraduate and graduate programs. The College holds a stellar 14:1 student-to-faculty ratio and has been recognized as a leader in engaged learning.
Florida Southern College enjoys an esteemed position in national rankings, including placements in U.S. News & World Report for the best regional universities and most innovative schools. The institution's commitment to providing valuable education and experiences to students is reinforced by its presence in prestigious educational guides, enhancing its reputation as a top choice for higher education.
Frequently Asked Questions
What is the role of the Anne MacGregor Jenkins Endowed Chair?
The chair focuses on pediatric nursing education and aims to improve health outcomes for children through research and community outreach.
Who is Dr. Sharlene Smith?
Dr. Smith is a dual-certified pediatric nurse practitioner with extensive clinical and teaching experience in nursing education.
What initiatives has Dr. Smith been involved in?
She has led various health improvement programs and participated in global health missions, enhancing community engagement.
How does Florida Southern College rank nationally?
FSC is ranked highly by U.S. News & World Report in various categories, demonstrating its commitment to academic excellence.
What programs does Florida Southern College offer?
Florida Southern College offers over 70 undergraduate programs and various graduate degrees, focusing on business, education, nursing, and more.
